name: Spaghetti Squash Mediterranean-Style
author: Jenny's Kitchen
summary: A fun way to make spaghetti squash the main event in this unique and filling dish.
ingredients: 1  spaghetti squash, halved lengthwise and seeded
3 (4 ounce) Italian sausage links, casings removed
1  red bell pepper, seeded and diced
4 ounces crumbled feta cheese, or more to taste
1 pinch lemon pepper, or to taste
1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley, or as desired  (Optional)
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Coat large baking dish with cooking spray
Place spaghetti squash cut-side down in prepared baking dish
Bake in preheated oven until spaghetti squash is tender when pierced with a fork, about 45 minutes
Turn squash over and bake for another 5 minutes
Scrape the strands from the skin and place into a large bowl
Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat
Add Italian sausage and cook, stirring occasionally, until sausage is brown and crumbly, 5 to 8 minutes
Return skillet to heat; add 1 tablespoon olive oil, spring onions, and garlic, cook and stir until onions are softened, about 5 minutes
Add zucchini, red peppers, and Italian seasoning and continue to cook and stir until the vegetables are soft, about 5 minutes
Stir spaghetti squash and feta cheese into vegetable mixture; cook and stir until cheese melts, about 3 minutes
Stir sausage into vegetable mixture; season with salt and lemon pepper
Sprinkle tomato and parsley on top to serve
